ai.summary: Grayswood walk (SCC) is a roughly 12.3 km moderate-route hike in the UK, offering a mix of country lanes, woodland paths, and open fields. The route provides steady walking with gentle elevation changes and views of the surrounding countryside and village scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail uses well-trodden tracks, grassy field edges, and woodland paths. Expect uneven surfaces, stiles, and some damp sections after rain. The surface varies from compact paths to muddy tracks, with gentle ascents and descents and occasional road crossings near Grayswood village.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather and ensure you wear sturdy footwear. Stay on official paths, watch for stiles and road crossings, and be cautious on wet or muddy sections. Tick exposure is possible in long grass; keep dogs under control. Bring a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a small first aid kit. Let someone know your route and expected return time; mobile service can be patchy in rural areas.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots or shoes with good grip
Energy snacks or a light meal
Map or offline GPS and compass
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn, with generally better conditions; winter walking is possible with appropriate gear but can be colder and muddier.

seo.title: Grayswood walk (SCC) – 12.3 km moderate hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Grayswood walk (SCC): a 12.3 km moderate UK hike through fields, woodlands, and village scenery. Practical safety tips and gear for a comfortable day out.
